rationale: Students of diploma electronics and communication engineering need to have a thorough understanding of fundamental concepts of Electronics and Communication. Diploma students undertaking this course are expected to apply the fundamentals of basic electronic communication system to analyze the different communication (Modulation and Demodulation) methods with its techniques, this basic course develop skills required to learn communication to meet the expectations of the industry.

courseOutcomes.description: Distinguish various signals and noise in communication system.
Interpret different parameters of analog modulated signals.
Understand sampling theory and waveforms coding techniques.
Identify line coding and multiplexing techniques for various applications.

unitOutcomes.description: Describe EM wave spectrum, frequency ranges and its applications.
Represent Sinusoidal, Rectangular, Saw-tooth, Impulse and Pulse waveform.
Describe communication system.
Justify the need for modulation.
Differentiate between analog and digital modulation using waveforms.
Distinguish between external and internal noise and noise sources.

topics.title: Electromagnetic (EM) wave spectrum, frequency bands and their applications domain
Signals and its representation: analog and digital Signal, Pulse, Impulse, Saw-tooth, sinusoidal and rectangular (In Time & frequency domain)
Block diagram of Analog and Digital communication system
Modulation: Definition & its classification based on analog & pulse signal as carrier. Concept of digital modulation
Noise in communication system, classification of noise, signal to noise ratio(S/N) and noise figure

unitOutcomes.description: Derive the mathematical expression for Double Sideband Full Carrier (DSBFC) Amplitude Modulation (AM) signal
Sketch the frequency spectrum of the DSBFC Amplitude Modulated wave.
Show the mathematical relation between carrier power, modulated signal power and modulation index
Sketch the frequency spectrum of DSBSC and Single sideband (SSB) Amplitude Modulated wave and Pilot carrier
Explain generation of DSBSC signal using balanced modulator circuit.
Define phase modulation and with relevant sketches.
Distinguish between Pre-emphasis and De-emphasis
Explain PAM, PWM and PPM signals with definition and waveform.

topics.title: Mathematical expression, waveform and frequency spectrum for the Double sideband full carrier (DSBFC) Amplitude Modulated wave
Modulation Index, carrier power, modulated signal power and modulation index
DSBSC and Single sideband (SSB) frequency spectrum, bandwidth
Power saving in SSB
DSBSC signal using balanced modulator circuit.
Mathematical representation of FM wave, waveforms, Frequency spectrum, Modulation index and Bandwidth of FM
Mathematical representation of PM and its waveform
Compare AM and FM
Pre-emphasis and De-emphasis
Generation techniques for FM wave : Phase locked loop FM modulator
Pulse Modulation techniques: PAM,PWM, PPM

unitOutcomes.description: Define the characteristics of radio receiver
Describe the functions of each block of super heterodyne receiver
Describe AM detection method
Explain functions of various blocks of FM receiver
Explain working of various types of FM demodulator circuits.

topics.title: Characteristic of radio receiver, Sensitivity, Selectivity, Fidelity, Image frequency rejection
Block diagram and working of super heterodyne receiver, IF selection, Image frequency
Envelope detector using diode
Block diagram of basic FM receiver
Basics and types of FM demodulators
FM demodulator using Phase Locked Loop

unitOutcomes.description: State the need for sampling theorem.
Describe the Nyquist criteria, Calculate the sampling frequency for any modulating signal
Effect of Sampling rate
Explain sampling techniques
Define the following: quantization, step - size, resolution, uniform and non- uniform quantizer, Quantization noise, Companding
Describe functions of each block of pulse code modulation (PCM) transmitter and receiver.
Describe effect of noise on PCM signal
Explain delta modulation and adaptive delta modulation
Describe slop overload and granular noise
Differentiate Delta and adaptive delta modulation technique.
Explain working of Differential PCM (DPCM) transmitter and receiver.
Compare the features of PCM, DM, ADM and DPCM

topics.title: Statement and proof of sampling theorem
Nyquist rate and interval
Aliasing error, under sampling, over sampling and critical sampling
Ideal, Natural and flat top sampling
Concept of Quantization
Classification of quantization
PCM transmitter and receiver
Advantage, disadvantage and application of PCM
Block diagram, waveforms, advantage of Delta Modulation
Disadvantage of DM (slop overload and Granular noise)
Adaptive Delta Modulation
Differential PCM
Comparison between PCM, DM, ADM and DPCM

unitOutcomes.description: Differentiate between bit, symbol & Baud rate
Draw RZ, NRZ (Polar & Unipolar),Manchester coding AMI & HDB-3 signal.
Explain 4 level digital multiplexing hierarchy
Describe TDM frame.
Explain PCM-TDM system

topics.title: Bit rate, Baud rate, symbol
Line coding techniques
Concept of Time division digital multiplexing, TDM frame
Block diagram of basic PCM-TDM system

practicalExercises.description: Identify and observe different analog and digital signals in time domain and frequency domain using simulator or VLab.
Measure amplitude of different sinusoidal frequency signals in frequency domain using Spectrum Analyzer.
Measure modulation index of an AM envelope.
Measure modulation index of an AM envelop by trapezoidal Method.
Obtain the frequency response of Pre-emphasis and De-emphasis circuit.
Determine Modulation Index of Frequency Modulated wave.
Locate various sections of AM radio receiver trainer kit and draw the waveforms at input and output side of each section.
Locate various sections of FM radio receiver trainer kit and draw the waveforms at input and output side of each section.
Check the demodulated AM signal waveform using envelope detector and draw its input output waveform.
Check the demodulated FM signal waveform using detector and draw its input output waveform.
Demonstration of fault finding of AM or FM radio receivers.
Obtain the response of AGC circuit of the radio receiver.
Based on the sampling frequency, reconstruct the signal.
Check the performance PCM system for various sinusoidal Signals
Check the performance of PAM system.
Check the performance of PWM system.
Check the performance of PPM system.
Simulate AM,FM and SSB signal using Simulation software

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member.
Follow safety practices while using electrical appliances.
Practice environment friendly methods and processes. (Environment related)

Give seminar on modulators, demodulators and communication techniques, types and applications.
Undertake a survey of different communication methods used in field.
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics.
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes.
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods.
With respect to section No.11, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities.
Guide students on how to address issues on environment and sustainability
Guide students for using data manuals.
